item.title: Brussels prepares ban on Russian coal imports and transport operators
item.description: New penalties need to be agreed by all 27 EU member states

item.title: Italy and Spain lead fresh round of European expulsions of Russian diplomats
item.description: Number of ejected officials reaches 300 as EU ministers discuss harsher sanctions on Moscow

item.title: US to announce fresh sanctions including ban on new Russia investments
item.description: Washington will also increase pressure on Moscow’s institutions and officials in response to atrocities in Ukraine

item.title: ‘Not my yacht’ — how murky structures cloud ownership of oligarch toys
item.description: German lawyer told Antiguan authorities that ships did not belong to Roman Abramovich

item.title: It is time to curb imports of Russia’s gas
item.description: Adding it to the list of embargoed products would make life as difficult as possible for Vladimir Putin

item.title: The US will be the ultimate winner of Ukraine’s crisis
item.description: America stands to gain in stature and influence in Europe, Asia and the court of world opinion

item.title: Zelensky tells UN that Russia must be ‘brought to justice’ over atrocities
item.description: Ukrainian president blasts Security Council for ineffectiveness in preventing Moscow’s invasion

item.title: State media bombard Russians with alternative version of the truth
item.description: Top TV hosts portray Ukraine in round-the-clock broadcasts as being gripped by a collective madness

item.title: Czech Republic sends tanks to bolster Ukraine forces
item.description: First time a foreign country is known to have supplied this type of offensive weapon to help resist Russian invaders

item.title: Russia moves closer to default as Washington blocks debt payments through US banks
item.description: JPMorgan declined to process two coupon payments due on Monday

item.title: Live news updates: JetBlue threatens Spirit’s planned merger with $3.6bn bid
Biden announces US, UK and Australia co-operation on hypersonic weapons
item.description: Expansion of trilateral security pact is response to rapid expansion of Chinese military

item.title: US and Australia boost space and cyber co-operation to counter China
item.description: Allies seek deeper military integration as Beijing develops hypersonic and satellite technologies

item.title: Fed to begin ‘rapid’ balance sheet reduction as soon as May, says top official
item.description: Lael Brainard suggests US central bank is prepared to take ‘stronger’ action on raising interest rates

item.title: Government debt hit as traders weigh prospect of further Russia sanctions
item.description: Coal futures rise and oil dips as countries discuss more punitive measures

item.title: Channel 4 sale leaves potential buyers in a quandary
item.description: Private sector is largely happy for the UK broadcaster to stay in public hands

item.title: Blockchain and financial markets: will computers push out brokers?
item.description: Cryptocurrency exchange FTX wants US futures markets to use its technology, bringing 24/7 trading and automated risk management

item.title: Twitter appoints Elon Musk to board
item.description: Tesla chief takes seat a day after it was revealed he had become social media company’s biggest shareholder

item.title: Twitter/Elon Musk: social media star becomes social media owner
item.description: Tesla boss acquires almost a tenth of company

item.title: Amazon inks deals to send its internet satellites into space
item.description: Arianespace, the ULA and Jeff Bezos’s Blue Origin to provide backbone for high-speed networks

item.title: Union victory for Amazon warehouse could change US labour movement
item.description: Grassroots Staten Island win shows the power of organising from the bottom up

item.title: Le Pen’s poll surge rattles French bonds and bank stocks
item.description: Investors price in greater political risk before Sunday’s first round of voting

item.title: Rising Le Pen energises final stretch of France’s presidential campaign
item.description: Far-right candidate has focused on cost of living issues, putting Emmanuel Macron on the defensive

item.title: Shell reveals another tax-free year in UK North Sea
item.description: Energy major receives fourth straight rebate for decommissioning old platforms despite soaring oil and gas prices

item.title: Instagram cuts influencer payments for short videos
item.description: Platform’s Reels format was considered a rival to TikTok but content creators say their income has fallen

item.title: UK developers edge towards cladding deal with government
item.description: Several housebuilders sign pledge to carry out fire safety work on mid-rise blocks in wake of Grenfell tragedy

item.title: Poland blocks EU move to sign up to minimum corporate tax
item.description: Warsaw move holds up implementation of landmark reform agreed last year

item.title: Why are gaming communities so toxic?
item.description: With the rise of ‘hate raids’ by trolls, players are trying to protect each other but companies need to do more

item.title: Ivanka Trump to testify before January 6 committee
item.description: Former US president’s daughter follows husband Jared Kushner in appearing before panel investigating Capitol riot

item.title: US watchdog fines former KPMG audit boss $100,000 over tip-off scandal
item.description: Scott Marcello to pay penalty for failing to supervise colleagues who received advance warning of inspections

item.title: Chief executives of mRNA vaccine groups earned $100mn in pandemic pay
item.description: Remuneration at the three big jab makers reflects surge in value of share options
